prompt: Die Glocke oben rechts ist nicht verfügbar, auch nicht wenn die Erweiterung "Alert Notification" installiert ist.
expected_answer: Stellen Sie sicher, dass Benachrichtigungen in Ihrem Wiki aktiviert sind. Sie können sie aktivieren, indem Sie die Einstellung `notifications.enabled` in `xwiki.properties` auf `true` setzen.
ai_answer:
https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/ 
https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/ 


Die Glocke oben rechts, die normalerweise Benachrichtigungen anzeigt, könnte möglicherweise durch die Erweiterung "Alert Notification" aktiviert werden. Es scheint jedoch, dass selbst nach der Installation dieser Erweiterung das Symbol nicht verfügbar ist. Es könnte sein, dass weitere Einstellungen oder Anpassungen erforderlich sind, um die Benachrichtigungsfunktion ordnungsgemäß zu aktivieren. Es wird empfohlen, die Einstellungen der Erweiterung zu überprüfen oder gegebenenfalls den Support der Erweiterung zu kontaktieren, um Unterstützung bei der Konfiguration zu erhalten.

![NotificationsWithRSS.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsWithRSS.png?rev=1.3)

## Notifications Macro

The [Notifications Macro is provided by its own application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Macro/).

# Settings

On the notifications menu, you also have a link to go to the "settings" of the notifications.

![notif4.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif4.png?rev=1.8)

By default, users only get notifications when they are mentioned or when actions are performed on pages they created or updated. For receiving other notifications, you need to select which "types" of notifications you want to receive. When a page is created? When a blog post is published?

You can enable or disable all notification types that belong to a particular application by clicking on the bells as"

"pplication contributes content in the Alert menu (contributed by the [Alerts Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Alerts%20Application/)) in the top bar, represented by a bell:

![Notifications.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/Notifications.png?rev=1.4)

You can find under this menu the notifications about some events happening on the wiki (a page has been modified, a new blog post has been posted, etc...).

The number of notifications is displayed on the top menu, just above the bell:

![notif1.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif1.png?rev=1.5)

If you have more than 20 unread notifications, you will not see the real count but this instead:

![MaxCounter.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/MaxCounter.png?rev=1.3)

When you open the menu, the content of the notif"

"ents

Minor events are not displayed on the notifications. But you can disable this filter.

![FilterMinorEvent.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/FilterMinorEvent.png?rev=1.3)

## Watched Entities

You can also decide to *watch* some entities. Either a location (a page, a page with its children or a wiki) or a user. 

### Using it

To watch a location, all you need is to go to that place, and then click on the "alert" menu (represented by a bell). 

![WatchedEntities.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/WatchedEntities.png?rev=1.4)

Here you can decide to watch either this page, this page and its children, or the entire wiki.

On the notifications settings (in your user profile), you will see the watched entities in the filters box:

![WatchedEntitiesFiltersUI.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/W"

"20Application/WebHome/WatchedEntitiesFiltersUI.png?rev=1.3)

The notifications settings from the user profile save which "types" of notifications you want to receive, while the options from the "alert" menu represent the pages/spaces/wiki you want to get notifications for.

You won't be able to click on the buttons if you don't have enabled some event type first:

![NotificationsTogglesDisabled.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsTogglesDisabled.png?rev=1.3)

### Auto Watch

By default, a page where you have made a major modification is automatically added to the list of pages you watch. It means you will be notified about changes on your work. You can change this behavior in the settings:

![AutoWatch.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/AutoWatch.png?rev=1.3)

### Follow a user
